dish_description: The dish is a fricassee or medley featuring sauted Brussels sprouts, browned sausage, and beans. It is a hearty and flavorful dish suitable for occasions like Thanksgiving or as a comforting home-cooked meal.

cooking_steps.description: Start by heating a couple of tablespoons of good olive oil in a pan.
Add the sausage to the pan. You can either make little balls or leave it in pieces as you prefer.
Cook the sausage until it's browned and has rendered some fat, which should take a couple of minutes.
While the sausage is cooking, trim the ends of the Brussels sprouts and slice them by hand or use a slicer for uniform thickness.
Once the sausage is basically cooked, add the sliced Brussels sprouts to the pan.
Season the mixture with salt and cover the pan to let it steam for a few minutes.
If the mixture starts browning and needs moisture, add the liquid from a can of beans and cook for a couple more minutes.
Finally, add the beans to the pan, warm everything through, and serve the dish.
